results.title: Co-operation, competition, conflict
results.brief_description: Based on the text book “Sociology” by Green, this film discusses how three fundamental social processes - competition, conflict and co-operation - operate to make society function.

results.title: Clydesdales
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Commission and Murray Brown
results.brief_description: Examines the physical build of the Clydesdale, indicating its suitability as a draught horse for haulage purposes. Also compares the use of these horses before and after mechanization.

results.title: Clunies Ross: a man of science
results.brief_description: The life, work and interests of Sir Ian Clunies Ross. Some of the rapid advances made in the 1940’s and 1950’s as a result of industrial and scientific research during his chairmanship. His many interests include the establishment of the Wool Research Foundation and also the Tropical Division of the CSIRO; artificial rainmaking; pasture improvement; science research applied to primary and secondary industry; improved status of universities and the building of International House at the University of Melbourne. His Memorial will be a National Science Centre in Melbourne. Narrated by Eric Pearce.

results.title: Clueless
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Scott Rudin, Robert Lawrence and Amy Heckerling
results.brief_description: Alicia Silverstone plays Cher, the most popular and glamourous girl at Beverly Hills High. Cher is a girl with a mission; she wants to find a love match for her debating teacher so she can improve her grades and a fashion makeover is a must for her dowdy friend. While she tries to organise everyone else’s love life, when it comes to her own she is utterly ‘Clueless.’ Amy Heckerling’s film about designer clad Los Angeles teenagers is an infectious comedy while Silverstone’s performance is delightful.

results.title: Clubbed to death
results.creator_credit: Madar, Alain Massiot and Yolande Zauberman
results.brief_description: Set in the outskirts of Paris, “Clubbed to death” offers a fresh perspective of the rave culture by setting it’s story amongst the Arab and African immigrant community that populate these poorer suburbs and vibrant dance scene. Elodie Bouchez (‘Dream life of angels’(1998), ‘Wild reeds’ (1994)) plays Lola, a 20 year-old club kid who falls asleep on the bus home one night and wakes to find herself in the middle of a popular night spot where local Arab and African teenagers go to party. On this eventful evening Lola pops an E and meets and falls in love with a boxer called Emir (Roschdy Zem). Like Alice in wonderland finding herself on the other side of the rabbit hole, the drugged out Lola must overcome various obstacles and opponents before she can be with her man. Her biggest hurdle’s are Emir’s vampy girlfriend and club podium dancer Saida (Beatrice Dalle), whose love for him borders on the obsessive, and Emir’s own struggle with heroin addiction. Director Yolande Zauberman chooses to treat this twilight world in a naturalistic, unflashy way through the use of hand held camera but heightens the visuals and narrative through the impressive electronic soundtrack which includes dance artists such as Massive Attack, Daft Punk and the Chemical Brothers. In French with English subtitles. Cast also includes Richard Courchet, Gerald Thomassin and Julie Bataille.

results.title: Clowning around 2
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Paul D. Barron, Julie Morton and George Whaley
results.brief_description: Simon “Sim” Gunner continues his journey in order to fulfill his dream of becoming a circus clown. Sim’s first job is as a junior “Carpet clown” in Paris but soon he finds himself in the Cirque De La Luna in Montreal. Eventually his clowning adventures take him back home to Australia where his ambitions come true.

results.title: Clowning around
results.creator_credit: Barron Films, Antonia Barnard, Paul D. Barron and George Whaley
results.brief_description: The story of a boy with a special dream and a teacher with a painful past. Simon Gunner dreams of being a clown; not just an ordinary clown, but a clown in a circus. This story is filled with wonderful characters and colourful settings and stars Clayton Williamson, Noni Hazelhurst, Ernie Dingo and Jean-Michael Dagory in a family adventure

results.title: Clouds above. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: Presents the more common types of clouds, and explains in detail the processes of evaporation and condensation. An animated sequence demonstrates how the sun, air and water working together cause water vapour to rise and how subsequent condensation causes clouds to form. Traces the complete water cycle. Shows the importance of clouds to humans, particularly in farming, fishing and aviation.

results.title: Clouds
results.creator_credit: Film Associates and Arthur D. Nelles
results.brief_description: Points out to the primary school pupil the variety of observations that can be made about clouds: their appearances, shapes and the way they build up or fade away. Illustrates also the importance of clouds as a source of water. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Cloud over the coral reef
results.creator_credit: Moonlight Productions, Lee Tepley and R.E. Johannes
results.brief_description: This film considers the effect of sewage pollution and sedimentation on the coral reefs of the tropics and also examines a severe ecological disturbance of unknown origin - the population explosion of the coral eating Crown of Thorns starfish, which may be caused by pollution or some other form of man’s activity.
